intro: Rosa platyacantha subsp. crassipes, commonly known as the broad-leaved dog玫瑰, is a shrub native to parts of Asia, particularly China. It is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and clusters of fragrant, pale pink to white flowers. The plant produces oval, reddish-brown hips that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a hardy addition to gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and long-lasting blooms.
